client.translation[0].definitions[0].def: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization
client.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a meeting with an important client
client.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a computer on a network that receives information from a server (=large powerful computer)
client.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: ADJECTIVES/NOUN + client
Most firms are desperate for new clients.
This is an important client and we do not want to lose her.
a major client
Some of our major clients have not taken the news of the merger well.
a potential/prospective client
Make sure potential clients know about all of your services.
an existing client
We are very keen to keep our existing clients happy.
a private client
There are more than 200 stockbroking firms eager to take on private clients.
a business client
Competition for business clients between travel companies is keen.
a corporate client
Our law firm represents numerous corporate clients.
advise a client
The surveyor will advise his client on the value of the property.
act for/on behalf of a client
The lawyer will write confirming that he agrees to act for his client.
represent a client
Mead was a top attorney representing major corporate clients.
deal with a client
They receive training to help them deal with difficult clients.
client + NOUN
a client base
The company quickly expanded its client base in the US.
client.translation[1].definitions[0].def: someone who pays for services or advice from a professional person or organization
client.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: It is one of the stockbroking firm’s biggest corporate clients (=clients that are companies).
Defence lawyer Ronald Cole said his client was suffering from deep depression.
client.translation[1].definitions[1].def: someone who buys something from a seller
client.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Most of the shop’s regular clients are men.
client.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a computer connected to another computer that controls it, for example in a NETWORK
